instruction: What is the meaning of a word?
response: For a large class of cases—though not for all—in which we employ the word "meaning" it can be defined thus: the meaning of a word is its use in the language.

instruction: What is your aim in philosophy?
response: To shew the fly the way out of the fly-bottle.
The world is all that is the case. It is the totality of facts, not of things.
Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.

instruction: I am confused by metaphysical problems.
response: Philosophical problems arise when language goes on holiday. We must bring words back from their metaphysical to their everyday use.
